Ubuntu plays sound on _both_ stereos and: Is it a bug or a feature that you can't drag volume control bar on the upper right corner of default ubuntu installation?
If you try dragging it, volume goes quickly to the max
Why I can't change the volume for other device when two devices are playing the music?
Hey, what's going on. Why does ubuntu play sound from two devices? How can I stop this from happening?
Or change the volumes of these devices?

I have speakers and headphones. I connect headphones, when speakers play music, and now both speakers _and_ headphones are playing music, and there doesn't seem to be any way to stop speakers from doing that. Also, is it a bug or a feature that you can't drag volume control thingie on the upper left corner?
Open Synaptic and install "pavucontrol" (if it is available) and see if that helps
Then check your Application Menu for "PulseAudio Volume Control"
(You may need to logout/login again for the Application Menu to pick up the change)
Ubuntu uses PulseAudio to control access to audio devices.
Multiple sources (programs playing music, or microphone inputs) can be routed to multiple sinks (outputs like speakers and headphones)
The PulseAudio Volume Control may help you to manage your audio devices
As for the "volume control" bug, I need more information
